FeedItems.Title: Augmented Reality in Xamarin.Android with ARCore
FeedItems.Summary:
Now that you’ve had a chance to augment reality in your Xamarin iOS apps with ARKit, it’s time to explore Google’s take on AR in your Xamarin Android apps. The new ARCore SDK provides APIs for Augmented Reality features, such as motion tracking, plane detection, and light estimation. These are the building blocks you will […]

The post Augmented Reality in Xamarin.Android with ARCore appeared first on Xamarin Blog.

FeedItems.Title: Go Large with iOS 11
FeedItems.Summary:
One of the more obvious user interface changes in iOS 11 is the larger titles that are used across the system apps, from the App Store and Apple Music to Notes and Mail. The Health and Contact apps are shown below: The title animates off the screen and shrinks to a normal-sized navigation bar when […]

The post Go Large with iOS 11 appeared first on Xamarin Blog.

FeedItems.Title: Introducing the Android SDK Manager
FeedItems.Summary:
To make the process of managing Android SDKs as smooth as possible, we’ve revamped the Android SDK Manager in Visual Studio for Mac to create a seamless, integrated experience. Not only does this new SDK Manager offer a one-stop shop for all things Android SDK, we’re also introducing support for automatic SDK dependency resolution. So, let’s […]

The post Introducing the Android SDK Manager appeared first on Xamarin Blog.

FeedItems.Title: 3 Big Things To Explore in the Xamarin.Forms 2.5.0 Pre-Release
FeedItems.Summary:
Over the past year we’ve been working on a couple of “big things” that enable you to create more performant applications on more platforms. With our latest stable release, version 2.4.0, we introduced performance optimized renderers on Android, nicknamed Fast Renderers. While faster platform renderers are a clear win, you really start to see the big […]

The post 3 Big Things To Explore in the Xamarin.Forms 2.5.0 Pre-Release appeared first on Xamarin Blog.

FeedItems.Title: Five-Star Apps with Mobile Center Test
FeedItems.Summary:
Five-star mobile apps are all about consistent and predictable output. It’s not a good experience for users when an app suddenly crashes or doesn’t format correctly on their mobile screens. Developers can easily avoid these scenarios by testing for various scenarios on different devices, and Visual Studio Mobile Center makes it easy to test your mobile […]

The post Five-Star Apps with Mobile Center Test appeared first on Xamarin Blog.

FeedItems.Title: Upcoming Webinar | Build Better Games with Unity and Microsoft Azure
FeedItems.Summary:
Register now to join David Antognoli on Tuesday, November 7 at 9 am PT to learn how to take your Unity games to the next level with powerful cloud services. He’ll walk through how to connect your apps to Microsoft Azure, adding compelling features that users love, like leaderboards and heatmaps, and demo how new […]

The post Upcoming Webinar | Build Better Games with Unity and Microsoft Azure appeared first on Xamarin Blog.

FeedItems.Title: Plugin and Permission Changes with iOS 11
FeedItems.Summary:
iOS 11 introduced some fun updates around permissions when accessing certain features on the device. I first noticed these changes when trying to access a user location with the Geolocator Plugin in a Xamarin.Forms application. To my surprise, nothing happened. Upon further investigation of the application’s Output, I noticed a message explaining exactly what I […]

The post Plugin and Permission Changes with iOS 11 appeared first on Xamarin Blog.

FeedItems.Title: Adaptive UI with Xamarin.Forms
FeedItems.Summary:
Xamarin.Forms has supported iOS, Android, and Windows for a long time. We’ve also added new platforms to keep up with the changing landscape, such as Tizen and macOS, with Linux and Windows WPF on the horizon. These platforms run on a wide variety of devices including phones, tablets, desktops, and TVs. This presents an interesting […]

The post Adaptive UI with Xamarin.Forms appeared first on Xamarin Blog.

FeedItems.Title: Give the Visual Studio 2017 Version 15.5 Preview a Try!
FeedItems.Summary:
With Visual Studio 2017 version 15.4 now stable and sporting some awesome new features, such as Xamarin Live integration, Android Oreo / iOS 11 support, and a smarter, smaller installation, it’s time to turn our attention to the next version of Visual Studio 2017, version 15.5! This upcoming release is now available as a preview […]

The post Give the Visual Studio 2017 Version 15.5 Preview a Try! appeared first on Xamarin Blog.

FeedItems.Title: Bring 3D Models To Life in Augmented Reality with UrhoSharp
FeedItems.Summary:
UrhoSharp brings 3D to a variety of platforms and uses its own binary mdl format for model files. There are many sources for 3D models, including cgtrader and TurboSquid, and formats such as FBX, OBJ, DAE and BLEND. Urho3D provides tools like AssetImporter and the Urho3D Blender Add-in so you can use these models. In […]

The post Bring 3D Models To Life in Augmented Reality with UrhoSharp appeared first on Xamarin Blog.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[tests] fix CheckSequencePointGeneration tests" (#995) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
On Windows all of the `CheckSequencePointGeneration` tests were failing.

Looking into, there appeared to be a couple things wrong with the test:
- The lookup for `inApkRuntime` looks like it should filter against
`Runtime == expectedRuntime` instead of `inApk.Length`
- `Assert.IsNotNull` will not work against `ProjectBuilder.RuntimeInfo`,
which is a struct

I'm not sure how these tests are working at the moment on other platforms.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed pull request "[build] update SDK tools URLs" (#992) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
On Windows, the `lint` tool installed by the build was broken.
This causes several tests to fail on Windows verifying features
around `lint` After looking into it, it appears the URLs used to
download the SDK tools were not found in:

https://dl.google.com/android/repository/repository-12.xml

The correct URLs appear to be of the form `tools_rx.x.x-platform.zip`.
Note Google uses `macosx` in this file name instead of `darwin`.
Not sure what version of the SDK tools were being used previously,
they must be a prerelease or nightly release.

Other changes:
- The command `sdkmanager --license` is now `sdkmanager --update`

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[tests] ignore lint tests on Windows" (#994) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Context in #992

The `lint.bat` tool installed to `~\android-toolchain\sdk\tools\bin`
appears to be broken on Windows, so a few tests are failing that use it.
Since the issue appears to be with the Android SDK, it is a lot simpler
to just ignore these two tests on Windows.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed pull request "Bump to mono/2017-06/1f4613aa" (#958) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Merged pull request "Bump Mono to 2017-10" (#943) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Opened pull request "[Xamarin.Android.Build.Tests] Lets retry a build if we get a native crash" (#993) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
We get a few probems when building with mono/xbuild. We get
the occasional crash :(

	at <unknown> <0xffffffff>
	at (wrapper managed-to-native) object.__icall_wrapper_mono_gc_alloc_obj (intptr,intptr) [0x00000] in <4fdc5ed61a074cafb49fa42deb20d521>:0
	at (wrapper alloc) object.AllocSmall (intptr,intptr) <0x000fa>

So what we might want to do is to retry the build if we get this.
It usually doesn't happen twice in a row.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[WIP] [msbuild] Add desugar support." (#991) at xamarin/xamarin-android

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Allow RecycleElement with null Template" (#1239) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description of Change ###

Expected RecycleElement with null DataTemplateSelector to not throw exception on Android. Actually throws an exception. Simply, supply a dummy prototypical cell that does nothing (context insensitive).

### Bugs Fixed ###

Found while investigating 60382 (which turned out to be by design)
https://bugzilla.xamarin.com/show_bug.cgi?id=60382

### API Changes ###

None

### Behavioral Changes ###

None

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Merge `xcode9.1` into `d15-5`" (#2943) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Merged pull request "[metalperformanceshaders] Revert" (#2941) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
- There's a number of issues on devices. The framework does not work on simulator and introspection could not spot them (if not run on devices)

- There are naming issues (found trying to fix the above)

- Some extranous [Model] are present too

This needs a more serious and complete review before being shipped.
